DOC.brief_summary: There strong indication ( combination ) polyphenols may attractive candidate prevention metabolic syndrome diabetes modulation pathway fatty acid metabolism mitochondrial function . We hypothesize combination specific polyphenols , partly distinct mechanism action , may physiologically significant effect fat oxidation additive synergistic effect , thereby improve body composition , insulin sensitivity prevent type 2 diabetes . The following objective address current study : ( 1 ) test short term ( 3 day ) effect combination polyphenols ( supplement EGCG either combination resveratrol resveratrol genistein ) affect systemic lipolysis fat oxidation overnight fasted condition ingestion high fat meal overweight subject
DOC.criteria: overweight men woman ( BMI≥25kg/m2 29.9 kg/m2 ) , age 3070 year , Caucasian , normal fast glucose ( < 6.1 mmol/L ) blood pressure ( systolic blood pressure 100140 mmHg , diastolic blood pressure 6090 mmHg ) , weight stable last 3 month ( ± 2kg ) . Exclusion criterion : woman lactate , pregnant ( post ) menopausal , regular smoker , people intensive fitness training , eg . athlete ( ≥ 3 per week ≥ 1 hour training ) , habitual consumption green tea ( 1 cup per day ) product contain green tea extract , total caffeine consumption > 300 mg/day , alcohol intake > 20 g/day , dietary vitamin dietary supplement , diabetes mellitus ( define FPG ≥ 7.0 mmol/l and/or 2hPG ≥ 11.1 mmol/l ) ; serious pulmonary , cardiovascular , hepatic renal disease : history cardiovascular disease , relevant medical disorder potentially interfere trial , current use medication interfere study intervention interfere study endpoints/hypotheses .
